LayoutNode.Content: File Free with TurboTax Self-Employed One federal and one state tax return filing included File faster by exporting Schedule C to TurboTax Self-Employed Pay quarterly estimated taxes online Buy a Prosperity Bundle QuickBooks Self-Employed customers find on average $4,340 in tax savings per year. Start saving time & money now with the Prosperity Bundle. Buy now & save up to 50% Why Kiva? Intuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world. That’s why we’ve partnered with Kiva , a non-profit micro lending organization. Kiva’s mission is to connect Intuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world. That’s why we’ve partnered with Kiva people through lending to alleviate poverty. Kiva microloans have helped 2.7 million entrepreneurs around the world, many from underserved communities. Kiva Intuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world. That’s why we’ve partnered with Kiva seeks to make opportunity a reality for everyone, by enabling access to capital and a supportive community. For millions of people around the world, entrepreneurship can be the only way out of poverty. This is especially true in underserved communities, but few take the leap, due to high risk and lack of financial support. That’s where our partnership with Kiva comes in. For each purchase of our TurboTax Self-Employed + QuickBooks Self-Employed bundle, Intuit gives a $25 loan to Intuit’s corporate social responsibility vision of powering prosperity for a Kiva entrepreneur. Kiva’s focus on making opportunity a reality for everyone aligns with Intuit’s corporate social responsibility vision of powering prosperity for a Kiva entrepreneur. Kiva’s focus on making opportunity a reality for everyone aligns with Intuit’s corporate social responsibility vision those who need it most. Why Kiva?

 

Intuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world. That’s why we’ve partnered with Kiva, a non-profit micro lending organization. Kiva’s mission is to connectIntuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world. That’s why we’ve partnered with Kivapeople through lending to alleviate poverty. Kiva microloans have helped 2.7 million entrepreneurs around the world, many from underserved communities. KivaIntuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world. That’s why we’ve partnered with Kivaseeks to make opportunity a reality for everyone, by enabling access to capital and a supportive community.Intuit’s mission is to power prosperity around the world. That’s why we’ve partnered with Kiva, a non-profit micro lending organization. Kiva’s mission is to connect people through lending to alleviate poverty. Kiva microloans have helped 2.7 million entrepreneurs around the world, many from underserved communities. Kiva seeks to make opportunity a reality for everyone, by enabling access to capital and a supportive community.
 For millions of people around the world, entrepreneurship can be the only way out of poverty. This is especially true in underserved communities, but few take the leap, due to high risk and lack of financial support.

LayoutNode.Content: Prosperity for Swapples Rebecca launched her business, Swapples, where she and her team make a healthier version of waffles that you can eat on the go. Rebecca went to Kiva after being turned away from traditional banks because she was too young. A Kiva loan is helping Rebecca purchase new raw ingredients, new packaging, and new equipment. Important pricing terms, offer details and disclosures
LayoutNode.SRC:
Prosperity for Swapples

 

Rebecca launched her business, Swapples, where she and her team make a healthier version of waffles that you can eat on the go. Rebecca went to Kiva after being turned away from traditional banks because she was too young. A Kiva loan is helping Rebecca purchase new raw ingredients, new packaging, and new equipment.Rebecca launched her business, Swapples, where she and her team make a healthier version of waffles that you can eat on the go. LayoutNode.Content: Prosperity for Dorpare Tea The Marcellus brothers launched their business, Dorpare Tea, inspired by their Haitian upbringing as children drinking ginger root tea. A Kiva loan is helping the Marcellus brothers purchase commercial kitchen equipment and expand their business operations.
LayoutNode.SRC:
Prosperity for Dorpare Tea
